cwd.description: Path to prepend to any relative source file found in beam files. Typically the workspace folder.

stripSourcePrefix.description: When source paths in beam files are relative, this can be used to strip a prefix so that they match the filename in the current workspace.

runInTerminal.description: The RunInTerminal DAP command to use

args.description: The command to launch and all its arguments

cwd.description: Working directory for the node to launch

env.description: Environment key-value pairs that are added to or removed from the default environment.

kind.description: Use an integrated or external terminal. Possible values: `integrated` (default) or `external`.

argsCanBeInterpretedByShell.description: Set to true if the args need to have environment variables expanded, etc. Default: false.

nameDomain.description: Should the debugger use shortnames or longnames.

nodeInitCodeInEnvVar.description: If given, the initialization code for the node will be put in the given environment variable, which should then be mentioned in the `args`.

stripSourcePrefix.description: When source paths in beam files are relative, this can be used to strip a prefix so that they match the filename in the current workspace.

timeout.description: How long, in seconds, the debugger will wait for the new node to connect to it. Defaults to 60.

elpClient.serverPath.description: The path to the ELP executable. If empty, uses the binary included in the extension

elpClient.serverArgs.description: The arguments to invoke the language server with

elp.buck.query.useBxl.enable.markdownDescription: Use BXL to query for buck project model.

elp.diagnostics.disabled.markdownDescription: List of ELP diagnostics to disable.

elp.diagnostics.enableExperimental.markdownDescription:
Whether to show experimental ELP diagnostics that might
have more false positives than usual.

elp.diagnostics.enableOtp.markdownDescription: Whether to report diagnostics for OTP files.

elp.diagnostics.onSave.enable.markdownDescription: Update native diagnostics only when the file is saved.

elp.eqwalizer.all.markdownDescription: Whether to report Eqwalizer diagnostics for the whole project and not only for opened files.

elp.eqwalizer.chunkSize.markdownDescription: Chunk size to use for project-wide eqwalization.

elp.eqwalizer.maxTasks.markdownDescription: Maximum number of tasks to run in parallel for project-wide eqwalization.

elp.highlightDynamic.enable.markdownDescription: If enabled, highlight variables with type `dynamic()` when Eqwalizer results are available.

elp.hoverActions.docLinks.enable.markdownDescription:
Whether to show Hover Actions of type 'docs'. Only applies when
`#elp.hoverActions.enable#` is set.

elp.inlayHints.parameterHints.enable.markdownDescription:
Whether to show function parameter name inlay hints at the call
site.

elp.lens.debug.enable.markdownDescription:
Whether to show the `Debug` lenses. Only applies when
`#elp.lens.enable#` is set.

elp.lens.enable.markdownDescription: Whether to show Code Lenses in Erlang files.

elp.lens.links.enable.markdownDescription:
Whether to show the `Link` lenses. Only applies when
`#elp.lens.enable#` is set.

elp.lens.run.coverage.enable.markdownDescription:
Display code coverage information when running tests via the
Code Lenses. Only applies when `#elp.lens.enabled` and
`#elp.lens.run.enable#` are set.

elp.lens.run.enable.markdownDescription:
Whether to show the `Run` lenses. Only applies when
`#elp.lens.enable#` is set.

elp.lens.run.interactive.enable.markdownDescription:
Whether to show the `Run Interactive` lenses. Only applies when
`#elp.lens.enable#` is set.

elp.log.markdownDescription: Configure LSP-based logging using env_logger syntax.

elp.typesOnHover.enable.markdownDescription: Display types when hovering over expressions.

erlangDap.command.description: Custom command to invoke the DAP debugger.

erlangDap.erlangInstallationPath.markdownDescription: Custom path for Erlang when starting the DAP adapter. It should point to a directory with `erl`, `escript` and other standard erlang executables.
